name: Abductive Reasoning - Fire Investigation
description: Tests backward chaining to find causes of fire-related observations

theory.natural_language: In fire investigation, smoke indicates fire. Fire requires fuel, heat, and oxygen. Electrical shorts can cause fires. Arson involves intentional fire setting. Faulty wiring causes electrical shorts. Overloaded circuits cause electrical shorts. Lightning strikes can start fires. Grease buildup causes kitchen fires. Unattended cooking causes kitchen fires. Cigarettes can cause fires when dropped. Fire causes smoke. Fire causes heat damage. Fire causes ash residue. The warehouse had smoke and heat damage.

queries.natural_language: What caused the smoke in the warehouse?

expected_answer.natural_language: The smoke in the warehouse was caused by fire.
expected_answer.explanation: Direct backward chaining: Fire CAUSES Smoke

queries.natural_language: What could have started the fire in the warehouse?

expected_answer.natural_language: Possible causes include electrical short, arson, lightning strike, or a dropped cigarette.
expected_answer.explanation: Multiple hypotheses: ElectricalShort, Arson, LightningStrike, DroppedCigarette all CAUSE Fire

queries.natural_language: If faulty wiring was found, what likely caused the fire?

expected_answer.natural_language: Faulty wiring caused an electrical short, which then caused the fire.
